result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:54 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin,  Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court for Tanner Douglas Bee. Defendant Tanner Douglas Bee in court. INCLUDES 22CF116 and 22TR511. DE confirms address. Atty. Stanek requests extension of timeline to file motions. ADA Rockow responds, requests motions to be filed prior to scheduling motion hearing. Court sets PSC. Adjourned: 9:56 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

9:53 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner Douglas Bee in court.  Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court for Tanner Douglas Bee. 22CF116 AND 22tr511 Atty Stanek states Collateral attack to be pursued  
9/15/22 deadline to file motions

Bond motion to amend. Def has been testing regularily. Court amends based on def
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

#1. hml
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF116 (PH) and 22TR511 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo and Student Intern Ali Casey  DF ATTY:  Jon Elton Stanek   DF:  Tanner Douglas Bee appeared. Case called at 11:02 a.m. Court notes 22CF116 is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. ADA Ballo calls Deputy Mikunda to the Stand. S/T Anastasia Mikunda. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Ballo. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. PL Exhibit #1 (Narrative of Deputy Mikunda). Cross by Atty Stanek. Witness excused. No further evidence. No argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Ballo states information will mirror complaint. Atty Stanek will proceed to arraignment. NG plea entered. Court will schedule. Atty Stanek states possible collateral attack motion. Court will address and set for motion hearing if needed at next courtdate. Court will extend deadline for 10 days for substitution request. Address confirmed. Court adjourned at 11:16 a.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Per pymt. Faxed: Dispatch, SCSO, Jail on today's date.    
**PPlan reinstated. Next pymt of $75.00 due by 7/1/22. jaf
Signed by SRN 6-21-22, c:DEF & SCSO, e:DA. cah
Unpaid June 1, 2022, attorney fees.  ($75.00 due per month)  This person may be released upon the payment of $75.00
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF116 & 22TR511 (INIT):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson assist for purposes of today only   DF:  Tanner Douglas Bee appeared from jail by video. Case called at 1:06 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for an initial appearance. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB correct. Understands charges and penalties. Waives further reading. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. Waives speedy preliminary hearing. DE will try to retain private counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.
